Fine Arts.description: A Fine Arts major focuses on the creation and study of visual art, allowing students to develop their creative and technical skills across various mediums like painting, sculpture, drawing, and photography. The curriculum often includes foundational studies in art history and critical theory to provide a comprehensive understanding of the art world. Graduates pursue diverse careers as professional artists, gallery curators, art educators, museum professionals, or illustrators.

Graphic Design.description: A Graphic Design major teaches students how to communicate ideas visually across both print and digital platforms. The curriculum typically covers foundational principles like typography, color theory, and layout, along with mastering industry-standard software. Graduates pursue diverse careers as graphic designers, UI/UX designers, art directors, or branding specialists in agencies, tech companies, and in-house creative teams.

Illustration.description: An Illustration major focuses on creating narrative and communicative images for commercial and editorial purposes. The curriculum blends traditional art skills like drawing and painting with modern digital techniques, often covering topics such as character design, visual storytelling, and concept art. Graduates typically find work as freelance illustrators for books and magazines, concept artists for video games and animation, or as in-house artists for advertising agencies.
